A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: So as the Marvel Cinematic Universe is doing so well\, Disney decides to apply the same silly light \"comedic\" tone to Star Wars. A mediocre Story\, everything but clever writing\, un-earned drama (tons of it)\, on your face \"toys to be\" characters... Star Wars the last Jedi is the worst entry in the franchise. A two and a half hours running time that had no significant meaning in the overall storyline. A movie full of memorable eye-candy cool cinematographic moments\, but not really scenes\, yet  epic and fan pleasing moments can easily dissolve without a strong story to make them believable (Because the script say so); is the GOT S7 syndrome\, writers that don't understand or do not care of the material. A film that was made thinking only in how the audience would react if we do this or that and not in actually telling a story.
